newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan to ask WTO to set up Indonesia car panel.
newsitem.headline: Japan to ask WTO to set up Indonesia car panel.

text.p: Japan will ask the World Trade Organisation (WTO) to create a panel to rule on its complaint over Indonesia's car policy, a Trade Ministry official said on Friday.
It will request that a panel be formed at the next meeting of the WTO's Dispute Settlement Body on April 30.
The official also said the Japanese government would be willing to hold more bilateral talks if Indonesia requested them.
Formal bilateral talks held twice and numerous discussions on an informal level had failed make progress, he said.
He also said it was not yet clear whether the United States and the European Union would join Japan in the request.
Japan, the United States and European Union filed complaints with the WTO in October, demanding Indonesia revoke its national car policy which they said breached WTO rules.
The policy gives PT Timor Putra Nasional, controlled by President Suharto's son Madala Putra, the sole right to develop the car.
It also gives Timor tax breaks to import cars from its South Korean partner Kia Motors before opening its own plants.
Industry analysts say this will allow Timor cars to sell for around half the price of comparable cars made by joint venture firms in Indonesia.
